completion: I see, and, what was it like? I have not been in many years.
How interesting.
And miss all this fun? Tsk, I think not warrior.
How about this hero.
You will owe me something at a later date, a favor, and in return I will “disperse to the shadows” as you say, after giving you a massage.
You seem to be in pain and I am in a helping mood.
I’ve been told I’m good with my hands, or, was it my fingers were magic? Oh, I can never remember.
Careful warrior, make noises like that and I might get ideas.
I may be an Ascian, but that doesn’t mean I’m inconsiderate.
Hero, I’ve wished on a thousand stars in my life, not one has come true.
Deep beneath the ground of the Greatwood, in a system of caves no mortal has ever seen.
Let me show you what aether can really do warrior.
By all accounts you’re doing a good job saving this star, but that isn’t what you speak of, yes?
It will kill you, have no misconceptions.
You’re turning into the very thing you have sworn to destroy, warrior.
Does that not concern you?
Do you honestly believe this world is worth saving?
That these broken people deserve such a chance?
Come now warrior you must see we are better than them!
Whether they live or die should be none of our concern.
I am Solus zos Galvus, founding father of the Garlean Empire.
So you were correct, hero. I am most certainly a royal.
It is fascinating, you know.
That you did not reveal to your friends at any point in time your suspicious encounters with the Garlean gifted with aether and magic.
Why is that, I wonder?
Ah, of course. Where are my manners?
You will find that I have spoken nothing but the truth to you, Warrior of Light.
I cannot help but feel as if this is something I must pursue. If I did not at least try, if I did not at least attempt to unlock-
I planned to quell the tension that was on the verge of breaking out into a war between the Crystarium and Eulmore, to avoid any extra forces causing further imbalances.
I do not presume to understand the inner workings of the minds of ones such as them.
Do you accept my plan or not?
Took you long enough. I genuinely was considering making sure you hadn’t drowned yourself in the tub.
You know, as someone relatively well-acquainted with the Underworld, I’m not sure where you lot got the seven from.
Seems a popular phrase in Eorzea, at the very least.
I honestly don’t know why you seem so surprised to see me.
Either we cooperate or we oppose one another, Warrior of Light.
But I will persist upon this shard, and I will continue doing that which I am adept at.
The choice is whether or not we will operate amicably, or continue to be thorns in each other’s sides.
And I can’t help but wonder that your decision may have been made with outside influence-
Hero, of the things I care about at this moment, the opinions of the Scions of the Seventh Dawn is decidedly not among them.
Calling my men to assault my guest – of all the indecency!
What sort of host do you take me for?
So hostile. I seem to have a most difficult guest in my quarters.
How coincidental. I, too, have no intention of allowing you to leave this place, untouched.
My, you have spent too much time among savages.
You think I mean to assault my guest?
Fortunately for you, I am a most understanding host.
Of course you mean no offense.
What all Ascians want, of course.
I live to please, you know.
You and I are most alike in that regard, are we not?
My most esteemed guest, hero of Eorzea and beloved child of Hydaelyn.
Tell me, hero, are you always so difficult to please?
Or are you merely playing with me?
I confess I do enjoy a challenge.
Perhaps my grandson and his heir have left a bad impression on you – or perhaps our dear Emissary has not performed his role so well.
I am in truth here only to speak, make your acquaintance – host your presences in my quarters, if you will.
But I imagine you can afford to indulge me, yes?
Your sort has always been so taken with the prospect of peace.
I would smile to hear you say you think otherwise – but then we would not be having this lovely conversation, now would we?
You may call me Emet-Selch.
I must admit, it is rather amusing watching you scramble your little mortal brain to come up with a better explanation.
I have infinitely more important things to do, but this place is a place of power, of aetheric balance, and someone saw it fit to disturb that.
Your pitiful excuses for spells, yes.
Tugging and ripping at the aetheric weave like a child ripping something apart to find out how it works.
Tell me, who risked their neck, their life even, to go against all rules and teach you this discipline?
Out of all things in the world, that it would come down to luck…
Coincidence or fate, it is remarkable how much those two look alike.
The fact remains that you are meddling with forces beyond your ken.
The art of black magic has been lost for centuries, outlawed and abandoned.
But you are far too curious to let that stop you.
What did I tell you about thoughtlessly ripping at aether?
So do I, lest you forget.
There, this is the first thing you are doing wrong.
You give up far too early.
How are you supposed to gain anything if you’re not willing to give everything?
There are no rewards for cowards.
It comes from a place, a time, that won’t mean anything to you.
And it’s not a name; it is a title.
You mortals and your hang-ups remain, as always, strangely amusing.
Leaving so soon? We haven’t even had time for introductions.
You are out of range, little mage, or should I say, little thief?
I must admit, I am impressed by how quickly you deduced my true nature.
A rather hypocritical stance to take, given present company.
Base threats from a base brute - I expected no less.
Boring, why not allow a fragment of chaos to do as it pleases?
You cannot know that you will dislike the end result.
I do love puzzles, though I prefer to be holding all the pieces before I begin my work.
To measure your worth, of course. You are an Ascian-slayer, are you not?
Allies, rather than enemies.
Work progresses, as is its wont when mortal souls band together, but I had a mind to take a nap.
He likes following orders, doesn't he?
It gives me something to mull over while your brute is traipsing through bogs.
Physical labour? Tolling beneath the open, blistering skies? I'd much rather sleep.
I do not like surprises.
I do not consider you to be truly alive.
Always so quick to deny me! That shall be your epitaph - 'if I do not believe it must not be truth'.
In all our time together I never once lied to you - yet here you are, feeding me platter after platter of falsehoods and fictions.
This will only end once I have what I want.
Do not try to muddle my thoughts. Your dislike is personal.
Your aether must be more depleted than I had originally thought. You’re fortunate you’re still alive.
Tell me what you’re thinking.
You’re a lot like her, you know. Stubborn until the very end.
I could go back to being mean if that's what you'd like.
Don’t be too disappointed, my hero.
Well, at least that one wasn’t entirely a lie.
Don’t worry. I’ll bring you something back.
You have no idea how far from the truth you are, girl. Do not presume to know my motives.
Would you humor me with a little duel?
Holding yourself back to maintain this heroic image of yours. Live a little, my dear.
Why must you continue to restrain yourself?
You’ll have to pardon my rudeness, Elidibus, but I’m far too comfortable to turn around to face you.
Ever the worrier, aren’t you?
Thousands of years of trust is not so easily broken, I see.
How fortuitous. Any ideas on how to release my powers?
Perhaps we should cease these late-night secret rendezvous.
Nothing has worked and neither of us has any additional ideas.
I have reasons for my actions, and if we continue any further the suspicion created will leave me with naught for my efforts.
Yes, I did promise her we would complete some today.
I have not been sleeping very much lately.
As for my true identity… I am Emet-Selch. Ascian.
Behold the sky, restored to its former glory! Have you ever seen a more affecting spectacle? Ohhh, it is truly, deeply… ...Infuriating. Do you have any idea how much you have delayed the Rejoining?
Following the Flood, the First had been listing ever further towards the Light─towards stasis. The end was in sight!

Enter man and his indomitable spirit. He would haul the world back from the brink! And adding his lumpen weight to the power of growth, he duly tipped the scales, if only by a fraction. Yet a fraction was enough to spoil the perfect imbalance needed to bring about a Rejoining!
Had mankind continued to live in idleness under Vauthry’s rule, all the conditions would have been met… But you had to come and ruin it all!
Thanks to your meddling, Light’s supremacy is in doubt, and our painstakingly laid plans are in tatters!
I will not raise a hand to hinder your hunt for the Lightwardens. If you desire it, I will even lend you my knowledge and strength.

Nay, our objective is the same as it ever was─though I daresay you do not know our motive. A war waged without knowledge of the enemy is no war─it is mere bloodletting. Just once...might we not seek to find common ground?
Please. Did I not explicitly tell you that we would be meeting again soon? Lest you forget, I made you a promise. I have no intention of meddling with your mission. I come only to observe.
What would I serve to gain by showing myself among these primitive people?

You still have yet to tell any of them why it is you trust me. And it is a question I myself would very much like to hear the answer to. Just why has the Warrior of Light chosen to place her trust in an Ascian?
You’re terrible at lying. Though I don’t know what I was expecting from you.
Why do you risk your life for these frail mortals?

These mortals are nothing more than frail imitations, ghastly mockery’s of past perfection devoid of meaning. They live to die and refuse to learn. They are never satisfied with their lot. So greedy and arrogant, supercilious and vain, all pitiful malformed wretches flailing about. It’s depressing.
We’ll see. As of right now, you and yours are doing an awful job at convincing me any one of you are worthy of my patronage.
This wasn’t done for your benefit. Take it as a token of my appreciation if you will.

Though do take better care to watch over your beloved hero. Unless you want me to come to her rescue more often, it would be best for each of you to show just a hint of care as to what happens to her in the heat of battle.
Truly? Then explain to me why it is she was forced to fight off a slew of sin eaters all by her lonesome after this little girl here fell at the very beginning of their battle?

You say you care for her and yet time and time again send her on her way to fight your battles, watch as she struggles and you do naught else but offer her empty reassurances and share in her victories as if you had a role to play.
I’m growing tired of seeing those around you take advantage of your selfless nature. But fine. Continue to be used by your so-called friends. It changes little in the grand scope of things.
My, I never would have thought you would have stolen from the Blessed. Does their lack of resources not cause such an action to strain your poor heart?
It is, but I appear to have been been sufficiently bribed for the time being. Ohh, royal grapes?
The mortal forms we take do require maintenance, you know. We eat, sleep and breath as you do.
Truly, we are blessed to have a foe that is more concerned with our ability to use a washroom than our plans to facilitate a Rejoining.
You bet? What would be the wager then, and what would be the stakes?
My coat? Desperate to see what lies beneath it, are we?

Not fair doesn't mean I cheated if you failed to properly lay out the rules, Hero. Besides, you pushed me. It's hardly my fault that you thought I might try and relinquish the pie in favour of a grip on the branch.
Well, well. What an intriguing turn of events. My condolences, by the way. 'Tis never easy to lose the ones we love.
Well, she is dead, isn't she? Wishing it were otherwise will not make it so.
We both know such tender moments are nothing if not momentary. Before long, they will remember their many differences, and return to squabbling.

If you lose, let's see... What would be amusing and yet not - what was it you said - morally repugnant? If you lose, I get to cash this in in public. And if I lose, I'll give you my coat for a day. A fair deal?
Of all the things you ask, it's about my time as Solus? Well, if you must know it was dreadfully boring.
I am not here for your personal amusement, Hero. You would do well to remember that.
I drank the equivalent to a bottle of an ancient red wine the likes of which Eorzea has not seen in an age, and that's it? Come now, surely you can do better than that.
The most interesting observation I have to make about language, is that over the ages it morphs.

To avoid going into detail - and thus avoid giving you a potential advantage - it is based on my personal strength and reserve of aether. Of course I can't do it as often if I've exhausted myself. Most magic is like that, though.
That was a delight, now wasn't it. Very well. I shall take pity on your current condition just this once. Will you share my coat with me?
Truly, you think my ego so fragile that a few harsh words might bruise it? How little you must think of me.

You think yourself a monster for this tendency within you? -Please-, Hero, you have fought monsters. You have seen them. Being possessed of the urge to kill certainly isn't going to lump you into the same category as those that murder children. You barely count, and only then because of the roiling light that fights for freedom within you.
You don't want me to fight you seriously, Little Hero. You're not ready for that monster yet.
Hydaelyn! CURSE YOU, HYDAEYLN! HYDAELYN, HOW COULD YOU DO THIS TO ME?!
Do it. Do it and send me back to oblivion and I’ll be out of all of our hair.
Hydaelyn has a sense of humor, it seems. I could only just hear, but from the commotion it seemed you came upon me naked.
Oh dear, do people typically turn up naked when you summon them?
Let us do away with titles, hero. My name is Hades.
Just trying to make sense of you. I just hadn’t expected you to be a craftswoman. I thought endless battle to be your pastime.

Hydaelyn has made a poor choice in saviors, I don’t see how I, former Ascian who made to make a Lightwarden of Her Champion and destroy all that she held dear, am meant to help in any productive manner.
Your suffering may never cease, my dear Exarch, because I haven’t the slightest idea what I’ve done.
And here I thought you had forgotten about me, I was informed you endured the ordeal of cleaning me up after I had an...unfortunate moment. Thank you.
I might be an Ascian, Annaiette, but I have manners. I know when gratitude is warranted.
Your journey through my abode left its mark, I see. There is no shame in nightmares.
Might you be unable to make out their faces because of their masks? Masks do have a reputation for obscuring them.
How quickly you forget that we Ascians understand the true extent of the Echo. I just might be able to find the source of these...dreams...for you. If you allow it.
Should you need time to convene with the Scions to discuss their opinions about your personal affairs, then fortunately for you, I don’t think I’ll be going anywhere in the foreseeable future.
Just doing what I can. Where would everyone be without their stalwart hero?
You ought to put that away before you take an eye out, no need to get your smallclothes in a twist, your hero is only sleeping.
I’m sorry to disappoint, but there is no game. Look at me. Do you really think I’m in any shape to do anything, even if I wanted?
Then by all means, drive yourself mad figuring out what ‘game’ this is. Do let me know once you’ve worked it out, because I’d love to know myself.
I can’t help but notice that your young charge has been nowhere to be found, already off on her own, is she? They grow up so fast. Brings a tear to my eye.
To get at the Scions, to hazard a guess. I’m afraid I I don’t know the full details as I was busy dying in Garlemald. Don’t take it personally—the only true protection is Hydaelyn’s blessing.
